description:
Hi All
I have install Nova on one machine , 
and every thing is going well until I want to access into gust vm which I run it using cloud-run-instances .
I can ping the vm with 192.168.100.2
but I cannot using ssh to connect to the vm . and will return me an msg as :
   >  ssh: connect to host 192.168.100.2 port 22: Connection refused
Also The image I use is from  http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/releases/10.04/release/ubuntu-10.04-server-uec-amd64.tar.gz
Hope someone can help me to solve this problems , Thanks very much !

Some info about my conf as follow :
1. network state (When the instance is running)
     >> br100     Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr 08:00:27:4b:31:b9
          inet addr:192.168.100.1  Bcast:0.0.0.0  Mask:255.255.255.0
          inet6 addr: fe80::a00:27ff:fe4b:31b9/64 Scope:Link
          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1500  Metric:1
          RX packets:84432 errors:0 dropped:790 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:14751 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:0
          RX bytes:8038180 (8.0 MB)  TX bytes:8269953 (8.2 MB)

         eth0      Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr 08:00:27:4b:31:b9
          inet6 addr: fe80::a00:27ff:fe4b:31b9/64 Scope:Link
          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1500  Metric:1
          RX packets:1383294 errors:0 dropped:522 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:152571 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:1000
          RX bytes:1308566940 (1.3 GB)  TX bytes:18026375 (18.0 MB)

          lo        Link encap:Local Loopback
          inet addr:127.0.0.1  Mask:255.0.0.0
          inet6 addr: ::1/128 Scope:Host
          UP LOOPBACK RUNNING  MTU:16436  Metric:1
          RX packets:428250 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:428250 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:0
          RX bytes:3465758395 (3.4 GB)  TX bytes:3465758395 (3.4 GB)

         virbr0    Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr 5e:62:9f:76:3a:76
          inet addr:192.168.122.1  Bcast:192.168.122.255  Mask:255.255.255.0
          UP BROADCAST MULTICAST  MTU:1500  Metric:1
          RX packets:0 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:0 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:0
          RX bytes:0 (0.0 B)  TX bytes:0 (0.0 B)

          vnet0     Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr fe:16:3e:17:b2:6d
          inet6 addr: fe80::fc16:3eff:fe17:b26d/64 Scope:Link
          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1500  Metric:1
          RX packets:218 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:2754 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:500
          RX bytes:25693 (25.6 KB)  TX bytes:394510 (394.5 KB)

2. the console output :
     >> [    1.253311] Freeing unused kernel memory: 308k freed^M
           [    1.255764] Freeing unused kernel memory: 1612k freed^M
           init: plymouth-splash main process (348) terminated with status 2^M
           init: plymouth main process (49) killed by SEGV signal^M
           cloud-init start-local running: Wed, 15 Feb 2012 06:46:47 +0000. up 20.91 seconds
           no instance data found in start-local
           init: cloud-init-local main process (329) terminated with status 1^M
           cloud-init start running: Wed, 15 Feb 2012 06:46:50 +0000. up 23.10 seconds
           found data source: DataSourceEc2 
           Generating locales...
           en_US.UTF-8... done
          Generation complete.
           mountall: Event failed
           init: mountall main process (53) killed by PIPE signal^M
          init: plymouth-stop pre-start process (487) terminated with status 1^M
          General error mounting filesystems.
          A maintenance shell will now be started.
          CONTROL-D will terminate this shell and reboot the system.
          Give root password for maintenance
          (or type Control-D to continue):
3. The nova.conf
  --dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
 --dhcpbridge=/usr/bin/nova-dhcpbridge
 --logdir=/var/log/nova
  --state_path=/var/lib/nova
 --lock_path=/var/lock/nova
 --use_deprecated_auth=true
 --verbose

--s3_host=10.12.60.82
--FAKE_subdomain=ec2
--cc_host=10.12.60.82
--ec2_url=http://10.12.60.82:8773/services/Cloud

--rabbit_host=10.12.60.82

--network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatDHCPManager
--fixed_range=192.168.100.0/24
--flat_network_dhcp_start=192.168.100.2
--public_interface=eth0
--flat_interface=eth0
--flat_network_bridge=br100
--network_size=8
--routing_source_ip=10.12.60.82
--sql_connection=mysql://root:password@10.12.60.82/nova

--compute_manager=nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager
--libvirt_type=qemu
title: Can access the instance with ping BUT cannot access into vm instance with ssh

comments.content:
Hi All
I have install Nova on one machine , 
and every thing is going well until I want to access into gust vm which I run it using cloud-run-instances .
I can ping the vm with 192.168.100.2
but I cannot using ssh to connect to the vm . and will return me an msg as :
   >  ssh: connect to host 192.168.100.2 port 22: Connection refused
Also The image I use is from  http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/releases/10.04/release/ubuntu-10.04-server-uec-amd64.tar.gz
Hope someone can help me to solve this problems , Thanks very much !

Some info about my conf as follow :
1. network state (When the instance is running)

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lyzforpro

comments.content:
To access the instance from the public IP, You probably need to open port 22 (ssh) within the default security  group.

See:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/enabling-ping-and-ssh-on-vms.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikeyp-3

comments.content:
Hi,

It looks like the instance didn't start - from the log:
          mountall: Event failed
           init: mountall main process (53) killed by PIPE signal^M
          init: plymouth-stop pre-start process (487) terminated with status 1^M
          General error mounting filesystems.
          A maintenance shell will now be started.
          CONTROL-D will terminate this shell and reboot the system.
          Give root password for maintenance
          (or type Control-D to continue):

such an instance would probably respond to ping, but not start an SSH server.

Do you have other instances which start OK?


This does not look like a bug in nova, but perhaps a misconfiguration ...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fifieldt
